dcterms:creator: Lior Wolf
Tal Hassner
Itay Maoz
dcterms:description: The YouTube Faces Database is designed for investigating the problem of face recognition in videos. It was created by taking each identity from the Labeled Faces in the Wild (LFW) dataset and searching YouTube to obtain the top six video clips for each identity, resulting in a total of 3425 videos for 1595 unique subjects.
dcterms:title: YouTube Faces Database

dcterms:creator: Lior Wolf
Tal Hassner
Itay Maoz
dcterms:description: The Labeled Faces in the Wild (LFW) dataset is a collection of face images designed for studying the problem of face recognition. It contains labeled images of various individuals, which serve as the basis for the identities in the YouTube Faces Database.
dcterms:title: Labeled Faces in the Wild (LFW)

dcterms:creator: Joe Yue-Hei Ng
Matthew Hausknecht
Sudheendra Vijayanarasimhan
Oriol Vinyals
Rajat Monga
George Toderici
dcterms:description: The CIFAR-101 videos dataset is used for video classification tasks. It consists of video clips that are categorized into 101 classes, providing a diverse set of video data for training deep learning models.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-101 videos dataset

dcterms:creator: Elad Hoffer
Nir Ailon
dcterms:description: The MNIST dataset is a well-known dataset for handwritten digit recognition. It consists of images of handwritten digits and is commonly used for training various image processing systems.
dcterms:title: MNIST dataset
